New Records: Sri Lanka bowled out for 77, their lowest total in T20I history
Key Match Events: Anrich Nortje's standout performance led the South African bowling attack in a one-sided match
Sri Lanka managed just three fours and three sixes in 19.1 overs
Post-Match Reflections: Sri Lanka's performance was far from the level expected in such a critical match
Miscellaneous Highlights: The New York pitch proved challenging for the batsmen with inconsistent bounce and swing on offer
Sri Lanka's inability to build partnerships or counter the South African bowlers' tactics was evident
Others: Kusal Mendis managed to top-score for Sri Lanka with 19 runs off 30 balls
The lowest total by any team in the T20 World Cup is 39, scored by the Netherlands against Sri Lanka in 2014
